derivation: from a prolonged compound of the base of G2360 (θριαμβεύω);
strongs_def: and a derivative of G680 (θριαμβεύω) (meaning a noisy iambus, sung in honor of Bacchus); to make an acclamatory procession, i.e. (figuratively) to conquer or (by Hebraism) to give victory
outline:
1. to triumph, to celebrate a triumph
  2. cause one to triumph
